position at

. Having been the driving force behind two startups, Menuabl and OrdrUs, I've honed a comprehensive skill set that spans the full spectrum of development, from conceptualization to implementation, that I am eager to bring to your team.

At Menuabl and OrdrUs, I was not just a developer but a decision-maker, shaping product direction, design, and technology choices. This multifaceted role honed my skills in full-stack development, user experience design, and strategic planning. I thrived in this environment with its diverse challenges, leveraging my natural curiosity and passion for learning. Whether it's mastering new programming languages, understanding complex systems or ..., I've consistently demonstrated my ability to dive into new challenges and emerge with robust, innovative solutions.

My approach to interface, program, and API design is deeply informed by my lifelong work in game design and development. This perspective has taught me to create interfaces that are not only functional and efficient but also engaging and intuitive, akin to the compelling nature of well-designed games. I apply this same philosophy to all aspects of development, ensuring that each facet of my work resonates with users and facilitates an enjoyable and productive experience.
After years of making pivotal decisions in a solo capacity, I am now eager to join a team where collaboration and shared expertise are valued. I am excited about the prospect of contributing to
and leveraging the collective excitement and knowledge of a collaborative environment to build innovative solutions.
Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to discussing how my background, skills, and passion for teamwork can contribute to the success of your team.
Warm regards,

I am writing to express my interest in the Senior Software Engineer position at CommonLit. With a career that spans over a decade in web development, including significant experience with Ruby on Rails, and a personal life deeply intertwined with education and learning, I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to your mission of transforming literacy instruction.

At Menuabl and OrdrUs, as a key decision-maker and developer, I honed a broad skill set that I believe aligns well with the requirements of your role. From conceptualizing ideas to implementing full-stack solutions, my journey has been marked by a continuous pursuit of innovative and effective methods in software development. Specifically, my foundational experiences with Ruby on Rails at OrdrUs, where I guided the application from Rails 2 through to Rails 4, instilled in me a robust understanding of web application design and a deep appreciation for Rails’ testing tools.

My interest in CommonLit is further fueled by my personal connection to education. My wife, an educational researcher and writer, has made topics like online education, assessment models, and reading strategies a regular part of our household discussions. These insights have broadened my perspective on the critical role technology plays in education. Additionally, having homeschooled two of my children, I’ve experienced firsthand the challenges and rewards of personalized education. This experience will be invaluable as I look to contribute to software that meets diverse educational needs.

I am particularly drawn to the collaborative and learning-focused culture at CommonLit. As someone who loves both learning and teaching, the opportunity to work within a team that values lifelong learning and knowledge-sharing is immensely appealing. The prospect of returning to a Rails environment, combined with the meaningful work of improving literacy and educational outcomes, is an exciting prospect.

I am eager to bring my skills, passion for education, and collaborative spirit to CommonLit. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss how my background, both professional and personal, can contribute to the continued success and growth of your platform.
Thank you for considering my application. I am excited about the possibility of contributing to a team that is making such a significant impact in the field of education.
Warm regards,

notes about your version:
i have no particular experience with CI. dont mention it.
its too generic. it reads like you are checking off bullet points

slides with friends is a two person business. the founders, and presumably the ones reading the letter, are a couple. i want to speak more personally and more plainly. im not writing to a hiring manager. i dont want platitudes. i want to focus on the specific ways that i am a perfect fit for this job.
things to integrate into the cover letter:
Menuabl was built with Vue 2 and hasura, which i adore.
ordrus managed its realtime needs with pubnub. pubnub was a joy to use when i chose it 10 years ago.
for menuabl my realtime needs were minimal enough to be handled entirely by hasura and apollo subscriptions.

for my personal projects ive been using vue/nuxt 3 and typescript for the last year. i still love the consistant organization that the options api offers and how that makes the codebase more readable. but (judicious) use of composeables solves a lot problems nicely too.

to keep busy while i find a new place in the work world im building a group hangout game, in many ways like your own app or jack box. we often bring small games to when we go out to eat with people to give a focus or push to conversation. im adapting some of my favorites to, phone friendly digital versions. though i try create games taht minimize staring at phones and maximize social interaction and discussion. it was originally inspired by the game Priorities and my frustration with its small number of cards. im building this with vue/nuxt 3, tailwind, pixijs and superbase. hasura would have been an easier choice based on familiarity but superbase offers more integrated services (auth/file hosting) and i wanted to have another take on how to think about the problem space.

I am thrilled to apply for the Software Engineer position at Slides With Friends, a platform that resonates with my passion for creating engaging, educational, and fun group experiences. With over a decade of experience in full-stack development, including significant roles in launching Menuabl and OrdrUs, I am eager to contribute my expertise in making software that's not only functional but a joy to use—much like bringing the best elements of game design to educational and collaborative tools.

Your mission to make group experiences more engaging through interactive presentations and quizzes aligns perfectly with my approach to development. At Menuabl and OrdrUs, I was pivotal in building systems that balanced operational efficiency with the delight of user experience. This involved employing a flexible codebase to rapidly adapt to user feedback and market changes, a practice that mirrors your need for a hands-on role to improve code reliability, speed, and organization.

I am particularly drawn to the opportunity to work closely with your technical co-founder, bringing my years of experience in VueJS, my understanding of HTML/CSS, and my practice in automated testing and CI/CD to Slides With Friends. My track record of delivering products and features end-to-end, with minimal oversight, demonstrates my capability to take ownership of projects and architect them for future maintainability, testability, and extensibility.

The chance to contribute to a platform that enhances learning and connection in such tangible ways is incredibly exciting. I am especially keen on projects like migrating to Vue 3 and TypeScript and architecting new interactive slide types, which would leverage my skills and experiences to further enrich Slides With Friends’ offerings.

Joining Slides With Friends would not only allow me to apply my technical skills and passion for creating engaging user experiences but also be part of a team that values deep work, autonomy, and deliberate growth. I am eager to contribute to a product that has a real impact on its users' lives and to learn and grow alongside a talented team.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the possibility of discussing how my background, passion for software development, and commitment to creating tools that enhance collaboration and learning can contribute to the continued success and growth of Slides With Friends.
Warm regards,

children.value: My name is Melissa Rodriguez, and I am writing this letter to express my interest in the Software Developer position at Redshore Digital Creations. I believe that I can offer a significant contribution to your team. My passion for developing efficient, creative software has only grown during my career, and I am excited about the opportunity to showcase my skills.

From my first internship at Reality Media Company, I've consistently grown as a developer throughout the years. Not only am I dedicated to completing my work promptly and thoroughly, I am also committed to actively learning from every experience I have. During my first internship, I learned about what it takes to succeed in this field, and I've carried that lesson throughout the years as I've worked.

Although I began as a Junior Developer at Ridgewater Software, I eventually earned a position as the Engineering Manager in charge of the digital platforms division. While overseeing this team, our division regularly exceeded user retention goals and grew our subscribers by 10% consistently each quarter. Working in a managerial role taught me many important lessons, but it also helped me realize that my true passion is for creating software. I am excited about the opportunity to bring this passion, experience and talent to Digital Creations.

Thank you for taking the time to review my application. I'm looking forward to talking to you and learning more about this position. I know I have a lot to offer this company, and I'd love to show you what I can bring to the team.
Sincerely,
Melissa Rodriguez
